title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.10 Part 9 | 24-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So Narada Muni told this hunter, can I beg from you one thing?
segments.summary: Narada Muni encounters a cruel hunter, Mrigari, and begins to instruct him on the consequences of his actions, specifically the unnecessary pain he inflicts on animals.

segments.key_quote: So Narada Muni said, if you are interested, I will find a way how you can become liberated.
segments.summary: The hunter inquires about how to become free from sinful reactions, and Narada Muni offers a path to liberation, requiring him to give up his bow and trust in Narada Muni for sustenance.

segments.key_quote: Then you should daily circumambulate tulsi by offering water and you should chant the Hare Krishna mantra continuously.
segments.summary: The hunter follows Narada Muni's instructions, renouncing his possessions, building a cottage, planting a Tulasi plant, and chanting Hare Krishna, leading to his transformation and recognition by the villagers.

segments.key_quote: A man in devotional service is automatically decorated with all good qualities, including non-violence.
segments.summary: Narada Muni and Parvata Muni visit the former hunter, now a devotee, and witness his compassion towards even the smallest creatures, demonstrating the transformative power of devotional service and association with devotees.
